physdesc.label: Extent and Medium of the Unit of Description

did.origination: Hill, David Octavius and Adamson, Robert

bioghist.head: Administrative/Biographical History
bioghist.p: Portrait painter David Octavius Hill (1802-1870) went into partnership with engineer Robert Adamson (1821-1848), brother of photographer John Adamson, in 1843. Hill had been commissioned to document the meeting that year which established the Free Church of Scotland (the result being his The First General Assembly of the Free Church of Scotland; signing the Act of Seperation and Deed of Demission - 18th May 1843) and looked to photography as a means of assembling reference images of the many individuals involved. He enlisted Adamson, who was familiar with Fox Talbot's calotype process and had established a studio at Rock House, Calton Hill, Edinburgh.

As well as the portrait photographs required for the painting, Hill and Adamson took many photographs of friends and family. They are also renowned for their studies of the fishing community at Newhaven. Their partnership was cut short by Adamson's untimely death, at the age of twenty seven, in 1848. Hill attempted other partnership but ultimately returned to painting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 7 volumes of portrait photographs (calotypes) bound in 7 volumes. Subjects include .............

accessrestrict.p: Open to bona fide researchers, but please contact repository for details in advance.

note.p: Publications: "The life of John Elliot the apostle of the Indians" 1828, "The Parsi Religion: as in the Zend- Avesta, "The Evangelisation of India", "The Caste System", "The lands of the Bible Visited","Darkness and Dawn in India" and others

Additional information: In 1852 he was admitted by the presbytery of Edinburgh as a Minister of the Free Church without charge. From 1853 to 1860 Dr Wylie edited the "Free church Record" and in the latter year he was apponted lecturer in connection with the protestant Institute.

note.p: Publications: "Modern Judea compared with Ancient Prophecy", "Scenes from the Bible", "Ruins of Bible Lands", "The Senenth Vial", "The History of Protestantism" (three Volumes), "History of the Scottish Nation"(two volumes unfinished) and others
